video_caption: The video begins with a white screen that transitions to the MetroEast Community Media logo, featuring a stylized 'M' and 'e' in light blue and pink, respectively, with the text 'MetroEast COMMUNITY MEDIA' in light blue. The scene then shifts to a blue background with red and white stars, displaying the 'LWV' logo and the text 'LEAGUE OF WOMEN VOTERS OF PORTLAND' in white. Following this, a blue background with a red star and the word 'OREGON' in white appears, accompanied by red and white stripes and stars. The video then transitions to a red background with a large red star and a blue star in the center, with the text 'ELECTION 2020' in white on a blue banner with red and white stars. The text 'Video Voters' Guide' and 'Candidate Portland City Commissioner Position 1 Carmen Rubio' appears below. The scene then shows a woman with long dark hair wearing glasses and a headset, sitting in a room with a white door and window blinds in the background. The text 'Bailey McLaughlin League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org' is displayed at the bottom of the screen. The video concludes with the same woman continuing to speak, with the background and text remaining consistent.

The video features a woman named Hailey McLaughlin, who is wearing glasses and a headset, seated in a room with a white door and a window with blinds in the background. She is identified as a member of the League of Women Voters of Portland, as indicated by the text overlay on the screen. The scene transitions to a split-screen view, showing Hailey on the left and another woman in a red top on the right, both engaged in a video call. The text overlay changes to "Video Voters' Guide," suggesting that the video is part of an educational series aimed at informing voters. The setting remains consistent throughout, with both women appearing in their respective rooms, maintaining a professional and informative atmosphere.

The video features a split-screen video call between two women, one wearing a headset and seated in a room with a white door and window blinds, and the other in a red top against a plain background. The text overlay reads "Video Voters' Guide League of Women Voters of Portland lwvpdx.org," indicating the context of a voter guide discussion. The focus then shifts to the woman in the red top, identified as "Carmen Rubio Candidate Portland City Commissioner Position 1," as she speaks directly to the camera. The video maintains a consistent setting with a neutral background, emphasizing the importance of the message being conveyed. The text overlay remains visible throughout, reinforcing the association with the League of Women Voters of Portland. The video concludes with the same text overlay, highlighting the organization's role in providing voter information.

The video features a split-screen video call between two women, one wearing glasses and a headset, and the other in a red top. The woman on the left is in a room with a white door and window blinds, while the woman on the right is in a room with a plain wall. A blue banner with the text "LWV Vote411.org lwvpx.org" appears at the bottom of the screen. The scene transitions to a blue background with white stars and text that reads "League of Women Voters of Portland Presents The Video Voters' Guide." Additional text provides voter information and websites. The video then displays a message reminding viewers to cast their ballots for the Primary Election on May 19th, followed by a list of contributors to the video. The final frame shows the logo of MetroEast.org, indicating the production company, and a Creative Commons license notice. The video maintains a consistent blue and white color scheme throughout, emphasizing the League of Women Voters' branding and voter information.
